trans-unit.source: Enable offline sync for your Azure Mobile App (Android)
trans-unit.target: Enable offline sync for your Azure Mobile App (Android)

trans-unit.source: Learn how to use App Service Mobile Apps to cache and sync offline data in your Android application
trans-unit.target: Learn how to use App Service Mobile Apps to cache and sync offline data in your Android application

trans-unit.source: Enable offline sync for your Android mobile app
trans-unit.target: Enable offline sync for your Android mobile app

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: This tutorial covers the offline sync feature of Azure Mobile Apps for Android.
trans-unit.target: This tutorial covers the offline sync feature of Azure Mobile Apps for Android.

trans-unit.source: Offline sync allows end-users to interact with a mobile app—viewing, adding, or modifying data—even when there is no network connection.
trans-unit.target: Offline sync allows end-users to interact with a mobile app—viewing, adding, or modifying data—even when there is no network connection.

trans-unit.source: Changes are stored in a local database; once the device is back online, these changes are synced with the remote backend.
trans-unit.target: Changes are stored in a local database; once the device is back online, these changes are synced with the remote backend.

trans-unit.source: If this is your first experience with Azure Mobile Apps, you should first complete the tutorial [Create an Android App].
trans-unit.target: If this is your first experience with Azure Mobile Apps, you should first complete the tutorial [Create an Android App].

trans-unit.source: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the data access extension packages to your project.
trans-unit.target: If you do not use the downloaded quick start server project, you must add the data access extension packages to your project.

trans-unit.source: For more information about server extension packages, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information about server extension packages, see [Work with the .NET backend server SDK for Azure Mobile Apps](app-service-mobile-dotnet-backend-how-to-use-server-sdk.md).

trans-unit.source: To learn more about the offline sync feature, see the topic [Offline Data Sync in Azure Mobile Apps].
trans-unit.target: To learn more about the offline sync feature, see the topic [Offline Data Sync in Azure Mobile Apps].

trans-unit.source: Update the app to support offline sync
trans-unit.target: Update the app to support offline sync

trans-unit.source: With offline sync you read to and write from a *sync table* (using the *IMobileServiceSyncTable* interface), which is part of a **SQLite** database on your device.
trans-unit.target: With offline sync you read to and write from a *sync table* (using the *IMobileServiceSyncTable* interface), which is part of a **SQLite** database on your device.

trans-unit.source: To push and pull changes between the device and Azure Mobile Services, you use a *synchronization context* (*MobileServiceClient.SyncContext*), which you initialize with the local database that you use to store data locally.
trans-unit.target: To push and pull changes between the device and Azure Mobile Services, you use a *synchronization context* (*MobileServiceClient.SyncContext*), which you initialize with the local database that you use to store data locally.

trans-unit.source: In `TodoActivity.java`, comment out the existing definition of `mToDoTable` and uncomment the sync table version:
trans-unit.target: In `TodoActivity.java`, comment out the existing definition of `mToDoTable` and uncomment the sync table version:

trans-unit.source: In the `onCreate` method, comment out the existing initialization of `mToDoTable` and uncomment this definition:
trans-unit.target: In the `onCreate` method, comment out the existing initialization of `mToDoTable` and uncomment this definition:

trans-unit.source: In `refreshItemsFromTable` comment out the definition of `results` and uncomment this definition:
trans-unit.target: In `refreshItemsFromTable` comment out the definition of `results` and uncomment this definition:

trans-unit.source: Comment out the definition of `refreshItemsFromMobileServiceTable`.
trans-unit.target: Comment out the definition of `refreshItemsFromMobileServiceTable`.

trans-unit.source: Uncomment the definition of `refreshItemsFromMobileServiceTableSyncTable`:
trans-unit.target: Uncomment the definition of `refreshItemsFromMobileServiceTableSyncTable`:

trans-unit.source: Uncomment the definition of `sync`:
trans-unit.target: Uncomment the definition of `sync`:

trans-unit.source: Test the app
trans-unit.target: Test the app

trans-unit.source: In this section, you will test the behavior with WiFi on, and then turn off WiFi to create an offline scenario.
trans-unit.target: In this section, you will test the behavior with WiFi on, and then turn off WiFi to create an offline scenario.

trans-unit.source: When you add data items, they are held in the local SQLite store, but not synced to the mobile service until you press the **Refresh** button.
trans-unit.target: When you add data items, they are held in the local SQLite store, but not synced to the mobile service until you press the **Refresh** button.

trans-unit.source: Other apps may have different requirements regarding when data needs to be synchronized, but for demo purposes this tutorial has the user explicitly request it.
trans-unit.target: Other apps may have different requirements regarding when data needs to be synchronized, but for demo purposes this tutorial has the user explicitly request it.

trans-unit.source: When you press that button, a new background task starts, and first pushes all the changes made to the local store, by using the synchronization context, and then pulls all changed data from Azure to the local table.
trans-unit.target: When you press that button, a new background task starts, and first pushes all the changes made to the local store, by using the synchronization context, and then pulls all changed data from Azure to the local table.

trans-unit.source: Offline testing
trans-unit.target: Offline testing

trans-unit.source: Place the device or simulator in *Airplane Mode*.
trans-unit.target: Place the device or simulator in *Airplane Mode*.

trans-unit.source: This creates an offline scenario.
trans-unit.target: This creates an offline scenario.

trans-unit.source: Add some *ToDo* items, or mark some items as complete.
trans-unit.target: Add some *ToDo* items, or mark some items as complete.

trans-unit.source: Quit the device or simulator (or forcibly close the app) and restart.
trans-unit.target: Quit the device or simulator (or forcibly close the app) and restart.

trans-unit.source: Verify that your changes have been persisted on the device because they are held in the local SQLite store.
trans-unit.target: Verify that your changes have been persisted on the device because they are held in the local SQLite store.

trans-unit.source: View the contents of the Azure *TodoItem* table either with a SQL tool such as *SQL Server Management Studio*, or a REST client such as *Fiddler* or *Postman*.
trans-unit.target: View the contents of the Azure *TodoItem* table either with a SQL tool such as *SQL Server Management Studio*, or a REST client such as *Fiddler* or *Postman*.

trans-unit.source: Verify that the new items have _not_ been synced to the server
trans-unit.target: Verify that the new items have _not_ been synced to the server

trans-unit.source: For a Node.js backend, go to the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com/), and in your Mobile App backend click **Easy Tables** > **TodoItem** to view the contents of the `TodoItem` table.
trans-unit.target: For a Node.js backend, go to the [Azure portal](https://portal.azure.com/), and in your Mobile App backend click **Easy Tables** > **TodoItem** to view the contents of the `TodoItem` table.

trans-unit.source: For a .NET backend, view the table contents either with a SQL tool such as *SQL Server Management Studio*, or a REST client such as *Fiddler* or *Postman*.
trans-unit.target: For a .NET backend, view the table contents either with a SQL tool such as *SQL Server Management Studio*, or a REST client such as *Fiddler* or *Postman*.

trans-unit.source: Turn on WiFi in the device or simulator.
trans-unit.target: Turn on WiFi in the device or simulator.

trans-unit.source: Next, press the **Refresh** button.
trans-unit.target: Next, press the **Refresh** button.

trans-unit.source: View the TodoItem data again in the Azure portal.
trans-unit.target: View the TodoItem data again in the Azure portal.

trans-unit.source: The new and changed TodoItems should now appear.
trans-unit.target: The new and changed TodoItems should now appear.

trans-unit.target: Additional Resources

trans-unit.target: [Cloud Cover: Offline Sync in Azure Mobile Services] \(note: the video is on Mobile Services, but offline sync works in a similar way in Azure Mobile Apps\)
